plugins.adufour.ezplug
Class EzVarNumericArray<N extends java.lang.Number>

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      plugins.adufour.ezplug.EzComponent
          plugins.adufour.ezplug.EzVar<N[]>
              plugins.adufour.ezplug.EzVarNumericArray<N>
Type Parameters:
N - the type of numeric values used in the array
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
EzVarDoubleArray, EzVarFloatArray, EzVarIntegerArray
public abstract class EzVarNumericArray<N extends java.lang.Number>
extends EzVar<N[]>

Abstract class defining a "numeric array"-type variable, representing arrays of numeric values that the user may choose from or input its own using the variable's parsing abilities

Author:
Alexandre Dufour
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

EzVarNumericArray

protected EzVarNumericArray(java.lang.String varName,
                            N[][] defaultValues,
                            int defaultValueIndex,
                            boolean allowUserInput)
Creates a new integer variable with a given array of possible values

Parameters:
varName - the name of the variable (as it will appear on the interface)
defaultValues - the list of possible values the user may choose from
defaultValueIndex - the index of the default selected value
allowUserInput - set to true to allow the user to input its own value manually, false otherwise
Method Detail

getValue

public N[] getValue()
Description copied from class: EzVar
Reads the value from the interface (here the default combo box). This default cast can be overriden with an input parsing method

Overrides:
getValue in class EzVar<N extends java.lang.Number[]>
Returns:
the user-selected (or -defined) value
